channel.title: RS2DS #377 Server framework, created by Public Boolean [Server & Client][Stable]
channel.description:
[center][b]RS2DS (RuneScape 2 Devine Server) #Build 0.01 #377[/b][/center] [hr] [center][b]Infomation[/b][/center] [center]I have decided to build my own stable #377 server and client, i did this becasue i thought 377 server were not that popular and i want to re-intoduce them, this is a very simple build of my framework Rs2Ds, and i am planning to realse more builds. [/center]
[center][b]Features[/b][/center] [center] [ul][li]Login[/li] [li]Player walking[/li] [li]Packet support[/li] [li]Rendering[/li] [li]Force Chat[/li] [li]Packaged[/li] [li]Very stable[/li] [li]Easy to Build on[/li][/ul] [/center]
[hr]
[center][b]Some Pictures of Client & Server[/b][/center]
[center][IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/10zakgl.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2m6a5p5.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2rh48ip.jpg[/img][/center] [hr] [center][b]Download Link[/b][/center] [center][b]Server[/b]: http://uppit.com/4OL8LE [/center] [center][b]Client[/b]: http://www.mediafire.com/?sharekey=531cda9deec6a64867cd7f7bd65f7eefb5ffb070409e0c225621d66e282a0ee8[/center]
[hr]
[center][b]Credits: Public Boolean, Graham (for Event manager), Anthony for some packets[/b][/center]

Therefor you just proved that you leeched/lied, you said you built this base yourself but its Whitefangs and I don’t see his name in the credits? So you’re claiming you built this base by repackaging, and removing MySQL? Lmao, mate try harder next time, this is a fail.

item.title: RS2DS #377 Server framework, created by Public Boolean [Server & Client][Stable]
item.dc:creator: @public_boolean public boolean
item.description:
@public_boolean wrote:

Taharok:

Unless I’m mistaken, you are only using the Event System to check if the server has been shutdown? If this is so, I advise you to try and expand toward making the Event System also handle each individual player’s processing. But, if you choose to do this, recreate the Event system to use a Thread group instead of an individual thread. You would need to take into consideration the fact that some updates may take an excessively long time to execute, so a Thread group is mandatory to prevent the entire server from locking up. This is just a suggestion, but it will increase the power of your server dramatically.

Yes, thats what i was planning to do, i was trying to make a event manager, which should be devloped in #Build 0.0.2, but i wanted the process for the character IDs to appear on the login, At the moment just using Grahams Even manager, but there are disadvantes with that, for the protocol of the 377 server.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2DS #377 Server framework, created by Public Boolean [Server & Client][Stable]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Unless I’m mistaken, you are only using the Event System to check if the server has been shutdown? If this is so, I advise you to try and expand toward making the Event System also handle each individual player’s processing. But, if you choose to do this, recreate the Event system to use a Thread group instead of an individual thread. You would need to take into consideration the fact that some updates may take an excessively long time to execute, so a Thread group is mandatory to prevent the entire server from locking up. This is just a suggestion, but it will increase the power of your server dramatically.
